review: Reclast (zoledronic acid):I am a 71 year old female who has resisted taking anything for my osteoporosis. But my lumbar number got to -4.4 and after trying other things to improve my numbers. I decided I needed something more. I had my infusion Monday morning with no prep. Felt fine until that evening. Then the diarrhea and cramping hit big time! Some nausea but no vomiting. My gut hurt, my teeth ached, my neck was stiff, and I couldn’t sleep for several nights. By the third day I was feeling better.  I don’t know if the prep would have helped but I have several friends who had no issues with Reclast. Not looking forward to next dose but will do with prep.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):Had Reclast infusion last Thursday. I was fine during the day. I even road my stationary bike the same night. But oh boy!! at 1:30 am I woke up with chills, and body aches like I had just did a marathon. I could not lift my left arm up, it was sopainful. Every part of my body hurt especially joints and areas that I have arthritis (osteoarthritis) . I am at day 5 and the body, muscle and joint pain are gone but I have no energy, am so tired and I have this headache for 4 days that is bothersome. I called the infusion center and the nurse stated headaches this far from infusion date is not the norm to call my primary care doctor. Made an appt. I would not tell anyone not to take this medication. Each person reaction can be different. I believe that if this medication works as is stated. I can deal with the temporary discomfort. But time will tell. All I know is I would rather have these symptoms that are not great than to have the pain of a fracture or worst be debilitated.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):My experience with Reclast was one of the worst things I have ever been through (including 6 back surgeries). I had my infusion on 12/6/20. By the next day, I couldn't move to get out of bed, without crying. It felt like every bone, & I mean every one, was breaking. I had to tell Siri to call my daughter, who came straight over (40 min away).  She had to help me out of bed, but everywhere she touched me, again felt like the bone was going to break, & all I could do was cry. I'm 66 yrs old, and have dealt with a lot of pain. This had it all beat!  My PCP called in a medication for arthritis, & my daughter covered my whole body with it. I had to use a walker to get up & that was still excruciating! It tanked my blood of all the vitamins needed. I was anemic & had to see a blood specialist. I went through this for 2 months, until my PCP put me on steroids. It helped but didn't completely remove the pain.  Finally, this month, the pain is gone. 14 months of that poison in my body!  BEWARE!
Reclast (zoledronic acid):Within 24 hours I had a killer headache,  chills, muscle pain, bone pain, nausea and dizziness.  It's awful!
Reclast (zoledronic acid):Reclast flared my fibromyalgia symptoms for about 5 months.  I did not repeat the experience.

Aclasta (zoledronic acid):I am now 65years of age. I had been given fosamax for three years due to early menopause. It did my BDM good. Then after some years I went for a bone density test and was given aclasta for three years 2014-2016. Then went off for three years. The radiologist/doctor doing the BDM scans was furious at me in 2020 for taking the gap. I then had Aclasta again in 2020, 2021. I do regular 4.5km walks during the week and also some times other pleasant walking outings. I do eat all the recommended foods high in calcium and also take calcium supplement every day. Lots of money spent on all these and my bone density dropped with 7,9% in 2022. NEVER EVER was I told about the severe side effects as I have lost bundles and heads of hair since 2014. Then it goes better, then it sheds so badly. I have constant severe back pain up my whole spine and joint pain. I have night sweats. I am tired due to anemia. Palpitations High blood pressure. Name it. IWILL NEVER TAKE TREATMENT AGAIN. Dr suggests Prolia @R68000

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I am an active 56 year old female with osteoporosis and degenerative bone disease.My dexy scan came back worse than last one so my doctor advised me about Reclast said they thought it would help with my bone loss to help keep from losing anymore bone loss. Feb.7 2022 I went in for first infusion I drunk 4 glasses of liquid before they did it and I felt fine. They took blood work and hook me up to IV solution ran it for a little bit then started Reclast then after 45 minutes they took IV out. I went home wasn't told what to do about any side affects if any.I  felt fine went to bed at 11pm that night by 1:00am I was shaking all over uncontrollably freezing like I was taking out of a freezer my bones were locked and felt like they were breaking. This has lasted 5 days I can hardly walk a lot of pain in my bones swelling and had a busting headache I only had before from seizures and I went to be tested for covid they said negative. So now I'm having a EEG to see if medicine cause seizures . NEVER AGAIN

Aclasta (zoledronic acid):Received 1st dose on Monday at 9:30am felt okay a bit tired in the afternoon. However at around 9:00pm pains in my sternum started. I took Panadol as advised, went to bed. By midnight I was shivering and shaking and ached all over, then intense pain set in, in my sternum and left breast and arm. I could hardly breathe and seated coughing. Temperature rose to 40 and severe sweats. More Panadol which did nothing. Pain worsened and could hardly walk. In the morning phoned lady who administered Alclasta who said was all normal and could subside in a day or two. Phoned my Dr who sent me straight to hospital where I spent the next 12 hours on pain relief, a drip and tests for suspected blood clots, thankfully none. I was kept until my temperature dropped and my blood pressure (190/98) to its usual 130/75.  Day 3 sternum pain has lessened to bearable, right arm still very painful as is my back. Very tired and nauseous. I wish I had read these reviews.

Zometa (zoledronic acid):I am 65 and consider myself strong and overall healthy.  I will never have this infusion again.  My side effects included vomiting, diarrhea, fever, severe neck pain, joint pain including thumbs and knees and my nose hurt.   On my oncologist's suggestion, I had a covid test and it came back negative for covid or the flu.   Now after 17 days, I am still experiencing flu like symptoms, late day fatigue and just an overall blah feeling.  I had a breast cancer lumpectomy in August and 4 weeks of radiation. I do not see any benefit of this drug and will try something else to get the calcium in my bones as the side effects are absolutely horrible.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I am 55 yrs old and had my first infusion a week ago. Later in the evening the pain started and I woke up during the night with the worst bone pain and headache I have ever had. I have fibromyalgia and osteoarthritis so I have a high pain tolerance. A week later and the headaches bone pain and nausea continues. Hoping it ends soon. Will never take this medication again!

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I am 73 and did my first reclast a year ago, I took extra vit C and D the week before.  Tylenol does nothing for me. I took advil and arnica the day before, during and after.  It has helped me with other procedures. I also asked for a 60 minute infusion not the15 min. one that is suggested. I read in a medical school publication that 60 drip has way fewer side effects...They don't tell you this...so you have to as for 60.min...I even gave the doc a copy of the article. A good friend trains nurses on infusions and she also confirmed that slow infusions are always better than quick ones - less pain, almost no side effects. Try to get the longer session. I  asked. They said yes ...no problem. Bring a book, phone  or tablet to keep yourself entertained. And something to drink while you're in session and something to eat after. Had no headache or flu symptoms...wear comfortable clothes.  CBD may also help...I like gummies. My 2nd session is  next week..The first I was nervous...not now
Reclast (zoledronic acid):After my infusion, I had a couple of days with feeling a little tired and chilled.  By day 3, I was back to exercising and feeling good.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I am a 70 year old female and received my 1st Reclast infusion late July 2021. My dexa score showed severe osteoporosis-3.6 in lower spine. I agreed to try Reclast despite my concerns over side effects. Although I initially experienced very mild side effects from the infusion, 3 months later I developed severe lower back pain, and left hip and leg pain which I can’t tolerate walking up stairs. I now must take meloxicam daily and  I’m sure that this back hip and leg issue is a side effect from Reclast. Reclast attempts to build bone density at the expense of cellular changes in which the body normally fights off inflammations and arthritic conditions. Do the research! There are a FEW blogs which detail women who take Reclast, and then several months later experience severe arthritic exacerbation.  This is MY STORY. My back is better due to 5 consecutive days of acupuncture BUT my left hip and leg are in pain. I won’t be doing Reclast again. The cure is worse than the disease!

I can honestly say that this has been one of the worst experiences of my life. I’m 54 and live with regular pain due to rheumatoid arthritis but the pain caused by this drug was another level. I hydrated before the infusion at 9am and continued afterwards, went back to my desk to work and all was fine until around 16:30 when I was finishing up a meeting and I realised my lower back was hurting. By 21:00 I had severe chills and every part of my body ached. That first night the pain was almost unbearable and I could only get to the bathroom by having my wife help me. I must have vomited around 40 times. It really was the night from hell. Day 2 was pretty grim, but my wife got anti-sickness pills and codeine from our family doctor which helped a little. This is day 3 and I can move about now slowly but still feel like I’ve been run over by a truck which then reversed over me. I have no idea how long it’s going to take to recover fully.I will NOT have this drug again.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):After first infusion I felt fine on day one. Day two my legs ached like I'd spent all day jogging. I took one dose of acetaminophen and then I was fine. Definitely worth doing to prevent osteoporosis.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I am a 63 year old woman. I had my first RECLAST infusion 5 days ago. I had a fever, chills and a major headache that lasted all night after procedure. I was not told to drink water or to take Tylenol prior. Make sure you do both! The next day I felt ok. The next night I had chills, fever, racing heart and Tylenol helped.  I have throbbing discomfort in my hips and a feeling of being unwell. I hope this subsides.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I am 64 and in good health otherwise and fairly active.  I had my treatment which lasted around 1/2 hour around 2 pm.  I am also small (under 5 feet and around 106 pounds.  I took an NSAID before the treatment —was not warned to stick to Tylenol. By evening I felt so sick —horrible shaking chills, bad heartburn, muscle and bone ache, light nausea, etc.  Started taking Tylenol  instead.  Today is Tuesday —4 days later and I am still not feeling great.   I get low level chills, sweats have a headache now.  I guess I am just one of those people who  doesn’t agree with the med.  I keep hoping each day I wake up this will be the day I will feel ok,. But has not happened so far.And, in this age of Covid , despite being triple vaxxed I would guess I could have Covid except the timing with the infusion is too coincidental. I agreed to play tennis on Thursday assuming 6 days later I would be ok., but ????      Hope its worth it.    Will dread the infusion next year.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I had my first Reclast infusion in September of 2021. I had taken Fosamax previously for 11 years with 2020 no medication. My last T-score was -3.8 in the left hip. Doctor advised me to go on to next step of osteoporosis therapy. I did research both medications that are available and chose Reclast due to the fact the reactions were less severe. I did hydrate prior to the infusion, I did not take any acetaminophen. My infusion took about 20 minutes. I had no reaction to the medication other than a slight taste in the back of my mouth during the procedure, nothing else. I will continue to receive the Reclast infusion for as long as possible.

Aclasta (zoledronic acid):I had an Aclasta infusion in July this year with flu like side effects of muscle and bone aches and pains, dizziness and difficulty concentrating for about 4 days.  After that I felt fine.  More recently I find I am consistently sore every morning, with bone pain over most of my body but particularly in the sites of old injuries.  The pain and discomfort abates with movement so I can live with it.  I’m hoping the Aclasta has good results

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I had my first infusion 6 days ago. I drank at least 64 ounces of water the day before. The day of infusion the nurse gave me 2 Tylenol and water prior to infusion, and I continued drinking plenty of water for two more days. I felt fine. But then forty eight hours after the infusion, I had pain and stiffness in my lower back, hips and shoulder. Since then I am taking Advil and using Bio Freeze. If these aches and stiffness continue, I will never get another infusion of Reclast.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):My advise Hydrate heavily the week priorTake Benadryl and two Tylenol one hour beforeAsk your doctor to order 1 hour of saline and 45 minutes for the reclast InfusionIt will make a world of difference I have had 4 treatments the first one was scary as I did not follow the above.  No issues with the last three My bone density tests show improvement

Zometa (zoledronic acid):Worst madication I’ve ever had. I got all the severe side effects. Joint and muscle pain, headache, nausea, chest and abdominal pain, chills. This medication is a torture. If you want to experience all kinds of body aches and pain, take this medication. I do not recommend it and I will never take it any more even if I was going to die.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):Last Friday I had my first Reclast infusion. On Monday prior to my infusion I began drinking a gallon of water each day and taking Tylenol in the morning and at night.  The morning of the procedure I drank 64 oz.   After the procedure I drank another 64 oz.  I’m continuing to drink the gallon of water but have stopped taking Tylenol in the morning.  The first night I had a slight headache but no other issues.  I strongly believe drinking plenty of water and taking the Tylenol made all the difference.  I have another bone scan scheduled for next year.  Depending on those results will determine if I’ll get Reclast once a year or every other year.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I had my Reclast infusion on 10-19-21 and will say I was extremely nervous from all the negative reviews. However my experience wasn’t bad at all. I’m on my 4th day after and feel great. I did however after 12 hours develop fever, chills, body aches, headache but they weren’t that bad. Very tolerable. The worst was the chills and severe night sweats on the second night. Felt a little tired and headache on 3rd day but great after. My Dexa scan was -2.4. I will get another bone density test and pray it’s improved. I will definitely do it again. Trust my doctors.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I had Reclast 3 years in a row 5 years ago without any side effects. Time to infuse again last May. I developed severe edema in my lower legs and feet that has not resolved in spite of taking Lasix daily. My legs are hurting me ! I had to cancel an annual girls' weekend because I am in extreme pain unless I'm sitting with my legs elevated. I had to see cardiology NP and a nephrologist, who said up to 20% of people get this edema. I want to know if it ever goes away. It's been 5 months!

Aclasta (zoledronic acid):When I started using Aclasta  in 2019 something changed in my body.I started feeling too much pain in my thigh but I thought it's maybe because of back pain I have. After that I started feeling legs knee and under feet. In 2020 became worse and worse, GP suggested me for physiotherapy for three months, nothing helped. I stopped my job because of the pain I had.When I checked the side effects of the Aclasta, I founded out exactly what they said about the side effects is what I have. I have appointment for another one on 29 October 2021 but honestly I will never take another one anymore! I should check long time ago when I started getting too much pain. My legs and feet swollen badly.Finally after waiting for three months I met Doctor of pain management and he said that I will get injections of back pain. He told me that Aclasta can cause the pain I have.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):This had been a horrible experience for me. I am 68 years old and had my first infusion of reclast September 24, 2021. I was in the ER the next morning with a very rapid heartbeat that woke me up in the middle of the night. I thought I was dying. I spent one night in the hospital and had all kinds of tests. It wasn't my heart causing problems. The reclast is causing joint pain, body aches, headaches, and hands that are swollen and painful.  One week out I still am not feeling well. I will never have an infusion of this drug again. My body hurts from head to toe.

Aclasta (zoledronic acid):I have been having Aclasta for the last 4 years and am due for my next drip in October.The drip needs to be administered slowly and you need to drink plenty of water beforehand. I have had no side effects! There has been an improvement with my bone density.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):Ten days ago, I had my first infusion of Reclast.  I'm 72 and have watched my bone density get worse over the years - down to -3.2 in my spine, but put off taking any bisphosphonate drugs out of fear of the side effects.  Acid reflux issues prevented me from trying the oral medications, and two endocrinologists recommended Reclast.  Because of my fear mostly, my doctor suggested we start with an infusion of 4 mg of Reclast over 30 minutes (a little longer time, and a dose decreased from 5 mg to 4 mg).  I drank the 6 - 8, 8 oz glasses of water the day of the infusion, and for 3 days after, and took a 500 mg tylenol an hour before, and two tylenols a day for 2 more days.   I had no side effects!  Now I wait, and hope I see some benefit.  I honestly wish I had done this sooner.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I had my 1st Infusion in March 2020, I made sure I was very Hydrated.  I had no side effects.I had my 2nd Infusion in March 2021. 6 Weeks later, had my Bone Density Test.I was at  -3.2 in 2020 when I started.  July 2021, I am at  -2.5Very happy with the improvement.

I was on prolia shot for a couple years and was great, but due to an insurance change they wouldn't approve it so I was upset for the fact that they would rather put my through an IV infusion drug instead. And even though I asked many questions I was told that the only complaints were achiness. OMG I was fine til 2:30 am. I swear someone broke all my ribs on my right side. I couldn't breathe , move, then on day 2 still the same even with pain meds they ended up giving me, but now throwing up and nauseous, headache and stabbing joint pain. Today is day 3 still the ribs hurt but not as bad and still can't even touch them and waking up with being nauseous. I will never do / take this again ever.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):At the end of July I had my third annual Reclast infusion. The first two improved my bone density numbers slightly so I decided to go ahead with another.I'd had no ill effects after the first two, but this last one hammered me. It triggered a bout of colitis that I'm still dealing with. I'm in a lot of back pain. I will not do another year regardless of any benefits it might give me.

I will be receiving my third, and hopefully my last, infusion of Zoledronic Monday, Aug 16th. After my first infusion in 2019, I began having pain in my joints. Later, I began vomiting, and essentially lived in the bathroom for the next 4 days. I couldn't keep down water. The bone pain was horrible and I was so weak from the continual vomiting. After four days, I began to feel "normal" again.In 2020, I had my 2nd infusion. This time I got a prescription for anti-nausea medication, (Ondansetron), and took it three times a day for the first 4 days, along with Advil/Tylenol combo, every 8 hours, for the next week. This routine changed the side effects to be minimal. Tomorrow, I will follow this same routine, and hopefully, my next bone scan will show improved numbers.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):58, with osteoporisis/osteopenia. Took Boniva for about a year, but have problems with reflux. Was not given any instruction to prep for my Reclast infusion. Felt fine afterwards - even went out to dinner. Woke up at 3am with mild body aches and took 2 X-tra strength Tylenol. By 7am, I was in severe pain all over my body. It even hurt to breathe. Called my doctor - she wasn't in, but other doc in practice said it was a typical reaction,, and that I could take Tylenol - but only 3x day. By afternoon, I was vomiting and could tell I was dehydrated. I considered going to the ER to get IV hydration, but live in a Covid hotspot, so chose to tough it out. I'm at 48 hours out now, took a dose of regular Tylenol 6 hrs ago, and still have neck pain and, oddly - pain in my left thumb. Other than that, feel kind of like I have the flu. Can only rate on side effects, since I won't know the outcome for at least a year.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I am 72 years old and got my first Reclast 4 days ago and no side effects.  I changed from oral because of a swallowing issue.  I have had no side effects as yet and feel fine.  I was very skeptical and worried about doing this but so far so good and in a year I will decide if I want to do it again.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I had a first reclast infusion last year May 2020. I was told to drink plenty of water make sure that I am hydrated. I was also told that possible side effects would be flu like symptoms and if so, take Tylenol. After the infusion, which the whole procedure lasted 30 minutes. Then I waited in the office for another 30 minutes so that they can monitor if there was any side effects. I felt no side effects. I basically went home took a Tylenol anyways just in case. The following day I still have no side effects. So far so good no complaints.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):My anger is directed at those who prescribed and administered my first infusion.  My doctor told me that Reclast had much greater efficacy than the Actenol I had been taking.  The techs at the infusion center told me that I had to drink 8 glasses of water for 3 days in order avoid the unpleasant side effects.  THIS IS ALL GARBAGE!  It turns out that Reclast has the about same efficacy as Actenol (if taken as directed.)  Per the manufacturer, 2 glasses of liquid should be consumed before an infusion of Reclast in order to avoid kidney damage, and Tylenol at the time of the infusion can minimize the side effects.  I'm a few days post infusion with no side effects (yet), although  I skipped the post-infusion water.  I strongly believe that the decision to risk the side effects of Reclast for the sake of convenience (i.e., avoiding the need for a monthly pill) should have been left to me.  I don't know whether the infusion techs actually believed the nonsense they told me.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I am 64 and received my first reclast infusion on June 21st to treat osteoporosis.  I was careful to hydrate well and didn't develop any flu symptoms.  My problems started the third day when I developed extremely severe eye pain. After 4 1/2 hours in Urgent care and multiple tests, the physician didn't think it looked like a typical reclast reaction, but had no other explanation.  A few days later my eye recovered, but then my hands swelled up.  Fortunately, this resolved also, but then came the knee and joint pain.  I suddenly have horrible knee bursitis for the first time in my life, and tendonitis in my ankles.  My doctor thinks perhaps I'm dealing with some sort of auto-immune problem.  I am now 18 days post-infusion, and  I can barely walk or even get up out of a chair.  Sheesh.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I had my first infusion of Reclast in April.  The only side effects I encountered was muscle soreness and chills for 2 days for which I took Tylenol.  After that no problems.  It will be about 1.5 years till I have a Dexa to prove whether it does any good.  I do resistance exercise, walk and take calcium & Vitamin D, and hope to increase bone density.  I am withholding a full rating of 10 until I get my Dexa results.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I am a 59 yo male with a L spine T Score of -3.9.  I had ignored my osteoporosis for many, many years until I felt that I had no choice to do something.  As a radiologist, I have seen many a spine with osteoporosis and multiple compression fractures that significantly reduce quality of life so I took the risk.   I hydrated prior to infusion but did not immediately take NSAIDs.  What a mistake. 8 hours after infusion (3 AM) I started to have severe, uncontrollable rigors (shaking chills) and diffuse bone and muscle pain that I have never experienced before.  As a reference point, I fractured my right pelvis years before in the Navy and I know what pain is.  Fever and chills improved with NSAID (first tried Tylenol and may switch to Naprosyn.  The pain is still severe.  The other testimonials are scary but I also know that there is no free lunch in medicine.  Everything we do is a balance between what helps and what does not.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I’m 54 and almost 3 weeks post my first infusion. Just recently diagnosed with post menopausal osteoporosis, and doc recommended Reclast as the easiest treatment. The infusion went well, but 24 hours I started having muscular back pain. It’s not getting better, and is fairly excruciating. It feels like back labor, spiking at 7-8 on a 10 point pain scale. After a few days, I called my MD and got muscle relaxants, ibuprofen, and topical NSAID's (diclofenac), but they’re not really helping. I just started a new job and am trying very hard to work through this, but I’m really getting worried. I need some serious dental work, too, but I’m not really inclined to take the assurances that it will all be fine in a couple of months at face value right now. I was not warned about preparing before with water, Vit D and calcium, don’t know if it would have helped. I’ll be glad if my bone density increases, but in any case, there’s no way I’m taking this again.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I'm writing this review to offer a different opinion than the scary ones I read the day before my infusion yesterday.  24 hours later, I have yet to experience any adverse reaction.  I didn't do anything particular the day before or the morning I received it.  I was told drinking lots of water was mainly to ensure good access to a vein.  Since I have a major vein that is easy to locate, I didn't do that.  I was given an acetaminophen (tylenol) in the doctor's office before the drip was started.  I watched a mouth watering British baking show on the big screen in the room and before I knew it, the IV was disconnected.  That was it.  Maybe I'll have some negative effects tomorrow, but so far, nothing.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I am 66 years old. I had my first Reclast infusion in December 2020. The first week was met with a severe migraine that lasted 7 full days. As soon as that went away, the bone pain came. My shoulders, ribs, hips, and legs felt like they were breaking.  I cried when trying to get out of bed or up out of a chair. Two weeks ago, the burning started. Felt like my bones were burning from the inside, & it was painful to use my hands. This is on top of my bones still feeling like they are breaking. This past week, the tremors started. At this point, it's getting harder to fight off the depression. I was a very active person. Side effects are getting worse. I fear this medicine will never get out of my bones, or that it's already caused permanent damage. Reclast has destroyed the past 6 months of my life, & my body. Does anyone have a timeline they can give me, for how long it took to get out of your body, where you had the side effects 6 months or longer?

Reclast (zoledronic acid):On March 9,2021. I received the infusion of RECLAST.  The worst excruciating painful experience I have had in my lifetime.  It hit my shoulders, my arms and neck to where I could hardly move.  I had to have help getting up to go to bathroom, could not even dress.  I woke up the following morning with this pain and I remained bedridden for 4 days.  I still have pain in arms and shoulders.  I will never agree to ANY medication for osteoporosis!!!  The pain is lingering. Sometimes I have to go to bed.  I hope I will get back to where I was before RECLAST and PROLIA.  I used to ride my Peloton cycle daily for 20-45 min now I’m unable to.  I’m going to Physical therapy to see if they can help me work thru this pain and have a quality of life  One night the pain was so bad I went to Drugs.com and found over 13 negative reviews about RECLAST.  Oh I wish I had looked this up before agreeing with my PA that I would try this infusion.   Never again!!!

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I had the infusion 1 week ago today and it has been awful, I woke up at 4am with severe muscle spasms in my entire back. I could barely get to the restroom. That last for about 15 hrs. Then can the headaches, sore throat and pain and weakness in my left hand. Along with that were swollen legs, especially my left one. I went to the dr. And he diagnosed it as phlebitis. That was 3 days ago. The phlebitis has steadily gotten worse. The headache and the sore throat finally went away. I am praying the phlebitis will clear up with antibiotics. So far no improvement after 3 days. I am most afraid of that. I will never allow myself to go thru that again. I am praying for no permanent damage to my body.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):After reading the horrible side effects people were having, I was apprehensive about getting the infusion. I was fine after mine. I felt tired, but that’s nothing new. I’m 70 and work full time and stand 6-8 hrs a day, 40 hrs a week. I’ve been fine, and so happy I got the infusion. I am so sorry for people who had horrible side effects.  It’s horrible you are suffering.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I am a 66 year old man who after 5 years showed NO improvement in the hip with Oral Bisphosphanates.  2 years ago I had a fragility fracture & broke my hip!  I also had a vitamin "D" deficiency.  With Forteo I got a 21% increase in BMD in my hip!   After 2 years Doc says go on Reclast or Prolia.   I needed to keep the gains from Forteo so I figured the benefits of Reclast outweighed the risks. I asked the infusion place what kind of feedback they were getting from return patients & they said it was more positive than negative.  I bet for every negative review you read there are at least 25 unreported positive experiences you'll never read about on any forum.  It was a very difficult decision for me to make but like my endocrinologist says, "pick your meds" .  The main thing is to weigh the TRUE RISKS as compared to the REAL BENEFIT.   Don't stay on a med that is not working.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I have been in pain for over 6 months after Reclast. Picking up a tiny cup of water sends pain to my back. I am okay if resting. Pain in all joints and bones.  I am 82. Never a bit of pain prior to this infusion. I have never fallen as an adult. I was never told by doctor to drink water a day prior. I would like to join a lawsuit if there is one.

Zometa (zoledronic acid):To date I have had no adverse reaction to this medication. I am a very active person .

Reclast (zoledronic acid):Do not use this drug or any bisphosphonate. The first year I used it  3 of my fingernails had lifted off their nail bed. My wife had an infusion of Aclasta yesterday. Last night she fainted, and has felt awful all day, dizziness, nausea, etc. She was not told to be hydrated before the treatment. Reclast (zoledronic acid):Had the infusion twice. The only side effect the 1st time was a slight headache. The 2nd time, no side effects at all. I highly recommend having this. Make sure you are well hydrate the day of the procedure.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):Had my first Reclast IV on Thursday morning. After a couple of hours started hurting all over and feeling terrible. I had a Zoledronic Acid infusion in January and did well with no side effects at the time. Reclast (zoledronic acid):I would never have a reclast infusion again. Felt OK for a couple of weeks and thought I had missed all the problems people reported from it. It has slowly gotten better, but still hurts some, but has taken 6 months to finally start to feel like normal.. Will not do that again....

I had an aclasta infusion last Wednesday, had 3 day of aches and pains and on Saturday suffered a mild stroke and spent 2 days in hospital. It started with a sore neck and headache in the centre of my neck and has now spread along the whole bag of my neck and starting to go up into my head.   I would not recommend this to anyone.

As a 50 year old I had gone from Osteopenic to severe Osteoporosis in 3 years using other medications. A friend who has had very good results recommended the treatment to me. I'm currently booked for my second treatment and looking forward to seeing results at my next bone density scan.

Aclasta (zoledronic acid):I had an anaphylactic reaction and a week later still have muscle pains in every muscle, chest pain, 'blocked' ears, metallic taste in my mouth, grey tongue covering, constipation and extremely painful feet, hands and chest. Aclasta (zoledronic acid):I have Osteogenesis Imperfecta. After getting Aredia for years and not seeing much improvement (maybe it prevented deterioration), I received Aclasta for 2 years and my bone density went from very fragile to just below average. Reclast (zoledronic acid):Reclast is a bad drug. It made my wife terribly ill! All side effects were devastating! It should be removed from use! Reclast (zoledronic acid):I am 41 with Crohn's disease causing my lack of vitamin absorb. I had my monthly entyvio infusion and right after my first reclast infusion just yesterday. Reclast (zoledronic acid):No side effects at all; Actually felt better afterwards.. More energy

Reclast (zoledronic acid):After having osteopenia progress to osteoporosis  and not tolerating oral medications, my doctor suggested Reclast. I would not recommend this drug to anyone and would NEVER, NEVER use it again.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):At age 54 failed my bone density had lost 20% of my bone mass in One year. I Participated in two blind studies and increase calcium an d intake.At end of studies found I had the placebos but had some positive results but not enough. Had my first Reclast yearly infusion 2012 no side effects and regained 10% of lost bone at bone scan.  Had second yearly infusion this past October again no side effects hoping for another positive scan in May.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I was diagnosed with osteoporosis at age 47. After completing 2 years of Forteo treatment, I had an infusion of Reclast in Oct. 2014. I didn't experience any side-effects from the drug. I walk five to seven times a week, take a monthly RX Vitamin D tablet, and ensure enough daily calcium with almond milk and supplements. My bone scan of 12/2015 show a -1.3 T Score. I'm back in the osteopenic range - and very happy.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I had the Reclast done March 2015. I read the reviews and had put this off for a year but I am glad I did it because now I have more energy then I did before.  I know I kept myself hydrated over a month faithfully and I experience no side effects.  Awesome

Reclast (zoledronic acid):Had my second infusion three days ago and had absolutely no side effects both times. Experienced dramatic 7-1/2% increase in bone density from the treatment after 8 straight dexas reflecting consistent bone loss. Could not be more pleased.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I am 52 years old with no other medical problems. After having a Reclast treatment I have had very few side effects. Reclast (zoledronic acid):2nd infusion 4 yrs apart. First time-hard chills during night Vit D level 40. This time low grade fever x2 days then outbreak of herpes simplex fever blisters of face. Vit D level 61.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I had my infusion on Friday.  My doctor gave me Tylenol at that time and said take one twice a day for 3 days.  On Sunday I woke up with some leg muscle pain. Reclast (zoledronic acid):I had my first Reclast I.V. injection last winter, just prior to the holidays. Reclast (zoledronic acid):Had first injection two days ago. Have had mild flu like symptoms took ibuprofen and so far it has helped. Weird pains here and there but they come and go and are tolerable.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):No problem whatsoever and Bone Density Test has shown some improvement..so will continue.
Reclast (zoledronic acid):I became very ill. Two days after injection, I ran a fever. A few days after that, I had vomiting and diarrhea and was exhausted. I also had joint pain.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I have read many bad reviews on this treatment, so let me tell you my positive one.  I am early 60s, very active, slightly built and failed my bone density scan.  Did my research (very important) and found a fabulous young female rheumatologist. Had a headache for three days, took medicines for the headache but carried on my regular business.  This was one week ago. I feel great.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):A very simple, painless procedure. Only upon the introduction to my system (which was my first experience) did I experience minor side effects, it's been 4 years now and I love it!

Reclast (zoledronic acid):No side effects with my first infusion 2 yrs ago. However, I did get high blood pressure within 6 monthss of receiving infusion. Blood pressure was normal to low prior to infusion.
Reclast (zoledronic acid):Should very careful if suffering from Osteonecrosis of Jaw, and avoid in pregnancy.

Reclast (zoledronic acid):I have had good results with Reclast, for osteoporosis.  I've had 3 infusions, in three years.  I am scheduled to have my 4th, this May. I have had no fractures during this time.  I have had flu-like side-effects, that lasted 1-3 days, each time I've had my infusions.  However, if you have them infuse the Reclast slower, over 30 minutes vs. 15 minutes, and you get well hydrated before, and stay hydrated well after, it will help.  There is currently a warning letter out in Canada, sent by Novartis, regarding Reclast causing serious Kidney issues, a few leading to kidney failure, dialysis, and even death.  Our FDA has not responded to this.  Make sure you have your Kidney Doctor's blessing, before you take Reclast.  I see mine next week.
Reclast (zoledronic acid):Had 2 infusions in 2 years--no improvement.
Reclast (zoledronic acid):I like the convenience of only having to take the once a year infusion.  I have had no noticeable side effects.
